comment: Wonderful professor! He made class interesting and wants everyone to succeed. Attendance is not required, but I highly recommend attending. He didn't use the textbook, so I wouldn't purchase it. It wasn't an easy class, but he is a great teacher and let's you know what to expect on the exam.

Dr. Lewis is perhaps my favorite professor I have ever had...especially when it comes to science courses. Though brilliant and entertaining, above all, he is a really great teacher. Everyone in the class understands what's going on at all times. Great guy. Great class. Recommended for summer semester especially. Makes 3 hours classes painless.

First C I have ever made and I'm a junior at KSU. He is a great professor. I always enjoyed going to his class and he is very helpful. I def recommend him. I had a B going into the final and that final is what killed me. He doesn't make it, but it is a hard final and his tests are difficult as well. Make sure you prepare for them!!

Professor Lewis is great. He understands what he teaches, and is able to easily explain it. Although the exams can be rather difficult, the class itself isn't too bad. Like any class you have to work for your grade. He's very helpful, and willing to stop while he's doing a formula just to help that one student who needs it. Highly Recommended!!!!!!
Wonderful professor and VERY helpful. He recognizes those who try and those who don't. Tests are not easy though!

By far the best chemistry professor out. He gives you plenty of chances to succeed in class, gives extra points here and there. Attendance is not mandatory but you will still want to go. He also curves your overall grade in the class

Dr. Lewis is definitely the best professor I've had at KSU. Highly recommended! He's approachable and very helpful. Material is difficult but he is always more than happy to answer questions & re-explain any concept. He actually WANTS you to succeed! Tests are fair. Study the power points and attend class. Take him and you will LOVE him!!!!

Without a doubt the best chemistry prof. you could take. Difficult material, but he makes it possible to succeed. Friday attendance is mandatory, some homework, occasional quizzes, 4 exams and 1 final (lowest test dropped). Study his powerpoints thoroughly for tests.Take him!Best professor I've had at KSU.
Great professor - highly recommend. Is very good at presenting and explaining the material. Have to keep on top of the material and study - but he outlines it well.

Dr. Lewis is the best. If you go to class with the powerpoints printed and follow along as well as study what he's taught often, you'll do fine. Most of my class got A's however, it's not a pushover class. Hard material but an awesome professor! HIGHLY recommended.
Great instructor.  I would highly recommend him.

He is a great Chemistry professor. He has a great sense of humor and always will tie it into the concepts he's teaching for the day. Although you have to work for it, the A is definitely not a difficult goal to achieve. He is always helping students on time and is willing to explain each concept until it is truly understood.

Professor Lewis is a wonderful teacher! He explains everything clearly and gives many examples to explain topics. He put extra worksheets on Vista to help with the material. Looking forward to taking him in the fall!

He is a great Professor. I took this class 1 year ago with Prof. Denton (Biggest mistake ever) and I made an F. I never understood a word he said. But I'm currently sitting at an A in Scott Lewis's class and I can actually explain topics and understand them. TAKE HIM. You will not regret it.

By far the best science prof there is. If he ever decided to leave KSU, science students just might be DOOMED. He explains everything to the MAXx. Try your best to get him for Chemistry. I'm thrilled he is teaching 1212. I just registered for his class and I'm actually looking forward to the Fall.

Good professor, very likable. First test was simple, but they got gradually harder. Drops lowest test grade. Attendance isn't mandatory but recommended because he covers many tips and exceptions to rules which are ALWAYS on the test. Very helpful, and responds to emails quickly. I would take him again.
Best chem teacher ever. Don't even bother to take chemistry if you can't get him as a teacher. Wishing I had him for chem 1212

this professor is so ossom his style of teaching is excellent he knows what he is talking about lecture notes are posted prior to the class. Exams are easy if you study the material the Fridays sessions are really very helpful..
Great to work with him Fall '10. I am doing it again in Spring '10 and would recommend him hands down.

Tests are 15 question MC no PC very easy to do well and fail. Very proficient teacher, extremely friendly available for help in office. Plenty of pre-test practice. Notes available from his website. PL is good practice in addition to free points. The best professor for chemistry I have had. Recommend for anyone who wants to learn the subject matter

Dr. Lewis is the best chemistry teacher I've ever had in my life. He provides so many opportunities for you to understand the material and the peer leading sessions were extremely helpful. He has a passion for teaching students chemistry and he definitely challenges you to learn the material.

Dr. Lewis is the best chemistry teacher I've ever had in my life. He provides so many opportunities for you to understand the material and the peer leading sessions were extremely helpful. He has a passion for teaching students chemistry and he definitely challenges you to learn the material.

Dr Lewis is AMAZING...  I am so sad he isn't going to be teaching CHEM 1212 next semester.  He is very helpful and always ready to answer your questions.  I had him for 1150 and 1211 and would love to have him for all my other required Chemistry courses if I could.  I HIGHLY RECOMMEND him for any Chemistry, he is very smart and knows how to teach.

Professor Lewis is incredible! Although the subject matter is extremely difficult, Lewis makes it a little more tolerable. He's a very funny guy and is good at explaing concepts and answering questions. He puts tests answers up then same night you take the test and you'll have your grade totaled the next day. I definitely recommended him.

This was my second time taking Chemistry 1211 and he made it better as far as teaching and understandable. I wish I had him for 1212 but he's not teaching that class next semester. I enjoyed him very much

Dr. Lewis is an incredible professor. He makes a scary subject fun and easy to learn. Took him this summer, which is intense for a chem class. I worked hard to get my grade. He puts lots of practice sheets on vista. He is always available thru email or office hours. Take him if you can, you won't regret it!

Best professor I've ever had! He is hilarious and makes you want to come to class. 4 exams and you can drop the lowest exam + final. He will help you to become an accomplished chemistry student. I would recommend anyone to him. If you study well it is very possible to get an A

Dr. Lewis, is extremely helpful if you go to him and make use of his office hours, ateendance is not mandatory but it makes it better because he explains the material in depth. An easy A if you study and pay attention

He is an amazing teacher. He does anything and everything he can to make his class enjoyable and interesting. He is always there for extra help. He loves his job which makes the class that much better. I absolutely would recommend him to anyone.  And he is so cute too!

Professor Lewis is the best!! he makes everything make totalt sense, and doesnt ever make you feel stupid for asking a question. He gives you points on the test if you just put chemistry is fun! He made my summer worth while!

Dr Lewis is by far the best professor I have ever had. Very dedicated & passionate about what he does. Extremely approachable & Pretty funny, as well. Always available to help students very prompt at responding to emails or discussion post.His office is always open. Posts powerpoints & lots of practice problems are online. Makes chemistry fun!

Dr. Lewis is seriously the greatest teacher.  He was always available whether through email/vista or office hours.  His research is on chemistry education and he really tries his hardest to figure out the best teaching strategy and is So helpful.  He's really smart but can translate it into the most simplest terms. Take him!!

Professor Lewis is the best!  He's the most helpful professor or teacher I've ever had.  His office door is always open, always answers emails within a day and answers questions on the discussion board quickly.  Read his notes, do the practice problems (he'll give more if you ask!), and ask him anything and you should do well.

I really enjoyed Dr. Lewis' class. He makes himself available for questions with quick email response and an open office. His tests are difficult and the material is challenging. That being said, you can do very well if you work for it. I highly encourage you to take Dr. Lewis' class!

Dr Lewis is the best! This guy was simply born to teach. I had taken Chem 1151 the previous semester with another instructor but  withdrew because I just was not getting it. Dr Lewis took the phobia out of chem for me and I was amazed at how he simplified it. Pay close attention to lectures, study his notes and you will do just fine.

Dr. Lewis is an amazing professor.  He is extremely clear and tries to make sure the student understands the material.  His tests are just that tests, he is ensuring you understand the material in the class, if you follow his instructions, you will do well in the class.  Probably one of the best professors I have ever had.

Dr. Lewis is a great prof!!! He gives worksheet online to help with retaining the material, quick email response, all class notes online, 4 tests drops lowest, involved on discussion board. He wants you to pass so there are no tricks. Highly Recommend him for any chem class he teaches.
hard tests

Probably the best teacher I've ever had. He makes class interesting and fun. Explains things so that everyone can understand. You have to work, but he explains material so well that it's easy to get a good grade. HIGHLY recommended!!

Dr. Lewis is incredible. Whether he's teaching the lab or the lectures, he makes sure you know what you're doing. He takes the time to know your name. One of the best teachers in the Chemistry Dept. I wish he'd taught advanced Chem classes.
One of the best professors at KSU. He is an educational chemist and is more interested in what you learn versus what you miss.
very hard tests. posts lots of study help and worksheets. very understanding

Best chemistry teacher at ksu. He breaks down material and makes it very easy to understand. He will help you as much as he can along the way. Attendence is not mandatory but to do well you need to go for lecture.

Lewis is the man, or bomb diggity as some would say. He mixes up his lectures with brief moments of comedy and is a really laid back guy. Some say his class is difficult but i haven't had a problem, just pay attention and take notes and you should be fine. TAKE LEWIS' CLASS!

He was funny, and looks like the guy off of the show the office. As long as you toke good notes, and understood the material he was great. and he was always willing to help you understand it if you didn't. The tests were hard for me but I am not good at math. I passed with a C. and I toke in the summer, so it was really fast paced
the BEST teacher i have taken at KSU i took his class during the summer semester and got an A. His teaching is VERY understandable and he makes sure you understand the material. TAKE HIM =)

Scott is super cool, his teaching is wonderful. You will understand it as soon as he teaches it but don't begin to think that chemistry is easy. The tests are what kill you, so be careful. You don't use the textbook at all! So hold off on buying till chem1212. Take advantage of all homework and all peer leading sessions!

this class is what you make it. GREAT teacher. possibly one of the funniest men i have ever met in my life. Keeps early morning chem classes exciting and cracks a LOT of jokes. I wouldnt say it's an easy A, but definitely do-able

Keep in mind that I didn't have him for lecture, only for lab.  He only actually showed up 2 times and when he did, refused to answer questions - he told me to ask my "peers" for help.  The class was taught by TA's.  And I thought that my tuition paid teachers; not TA's.  I was NOT impressed and got nothing from this portion of lab.

I had him for Spring 2009. He's a great teacher! He's very helpful. Always has his office open. Offers tons of homework grades along with test to boost your grade. Studying is a must...attendance is NOT mandatory. oh...and he's EXTREMELY good looking which helps! :)

LOVE THIS CLASS! very very clear and intresting lectures. lots of assignments for your own practice posted on webct but very few are actually collected for grades. Fair grader and prepares you for exactly what will be on the test. Definitely an easy A and you learn alot!!
Great professor...a student's professor. Always online to help out, grades get back to you ASAP, and he makes the class a lot of fun.
He is awesome.
He keeps class really interesting!

He is an awesome teacher. Very fresh in his teaching. He's such a funny guy and keeps my attention the entire lecture. He also gives worksheets to help you study. Good guy ... especially for this class.
He is a great teacher and makes little jokes to keep class entertained. Tests are kinda hard just because it is over lots of material. He is always there to help and his powerpoint notes are on webCT

He is a great teacher and I highly recomend him! All his notes are powerpoints and they're all on webct. Plus if you study the notes and do the practice tests online you'll get an A on tests. He has a few homework assignments, some of which are for completion only, and homework is out of about 190 points and he gives way more than 190. TAKE HIM!!!!

I took Chem 1101 Lab with him last semester. So cute... haha. Very nice teacher, goes out of way to help, sometimes girls will just call him over to talk to talk to him about their personal lives, because he's that nice. Definitely teaches very well, though, RECOMMEND HIM
great teacher, willing to go out of his way to help. I wish he taught 1152.

I was pretty stressed about taking this class at first, but it was very easy. Alot of math and some memorization. He narrows everything down so you know what to focus on and leaves all the other stuff out. Print out the power points and take notes. He says you don't have to go to class, but go. Quizzes/homework are not on the syllabus.
Not a great teacher. I was in his 1st class he ever taught, and he had a hard time explaning anything. He did give a huge curve at the end so the entire class wouldn't fail though.

Extremely nice & helpful. I only studied the PowerPoints for the tests. 5 quizzes (1 dropped), 4 tests (1 dropped), final, & writing assignment. Tests m/c & open question. Quick with email & provided ample problems in class (practice problems online, practice test problems, & test reviews. If he taught upper level I would take him.

One of the few teachers who likes to give the class a laugh while he teaches. Tests are moderately difficult, but about 22 out of 30 points on the quizzes are awarded for spelling your name correctly. Class notes prepared ahead and available on Vista for class the following day and sets up discussion board for peer help. Great Class & Prof!!

Professor Lewis is a great teacher.  He is always there to help you.  His notes are straight from powerpoint.  His test are full of math, but he reviews everything you need to know prior to taking the test.  He has an open chat thing on vista so you can contact him at anytime for questions. He also posts practice worksheets and links for studying.

Dr. Lewis has a wonderful personality and is interesting.  However, his tests are HARD.  He teaches differently than what his tests portray and his tests are full of MATH.  He doesn't give enough examples in class, but he definitely knows his stuff.  I wouldn't take him again unless no other option available.
